Interview Questions: 1) are you familiar with HMC 2) describe the role autodiff plays in HMC 3) explain the connection between reverse mode autodiff and the chain rule 4) explain where the logprob comes from 5) what's a divergence? what are some divergence diagnostics.

In-person interview with three panel members. 
Red flags: They started the interview late as if they weren't concerned that I'm a student and I have classes to attend. They asked me for my name as if they didn't even know who they scheduled for an interview in that timeslot. When I spoke about my past employer they all gave a surprised/impressed "oooh" reaction meaning that they clearly did not even read my resume. Three people on this panel and not a single one knew my name or my resume details.
Interview Questions:
What do you bring to this job?
Why did you apply?
How would your friends/family describe you?
Best/worst learning experience (work related or personal)?
How do you deal with conflict?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: For this position, there was no interview required.  All students enrolled in the department completing a thesis-based master's or PhD degree will automatically qualify to be a teaching assistant.
Interview Questions: Fill in payroll information

title: Invigilator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: No interview, job based on personal choice of hours whenever you are available to take a shift. Just a simple background check, nothing else needed. Great for a side job as a student
Interview Questions: What days are you available?

title: Clinical Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McMaster University (Waterloo, ON) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Lots of behavioural questions 
Why did you apply for the job 
Future goals and aspirations
How the job will help achieve future goals
Past experience relating to the job
Describing past work experiences (or volunteer)
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for the job

title: Engineering Recruitment Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone. Very casual discussing my qualifications and experiences noted on my resume. Extremely friendly and accommodating to my circumstance as I could not go for an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Do you think you can balance your course load with this as a part-time job?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at McMaster University
Interview Descriptions: The program assistant position is specifically targeted at Social Sciences graduates. They will send you an email to their target audience, and you can send in your resume and cover letter. A week after the deadline you should get a call to come in for an interview. They only call people who are selected for an interview. They give you time options, and then you can choose the date and time that works best for you. I was interviewed by three people, the atmosphere is very friendly and welcoming, but the interview questions were very specific and situational based questions, making the interview quite difficult. It seems they look for very creative individuals who can problem solve, and have leadership qualities that can engage the disinterested.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Barista Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Sit down with the manager outside of Starbucks on one of the tables.
They will ask typical questions you would see online (tell me your strengths and weaknesses).
As long as you seem like you will be hard working or you are referred by a current employee you will get the job.
Interview Questions: Did you ever come across a difficult situation with a coworker?

title: Community Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at McMaster University
Interview Descriptions: Positive interview process with multiple sessions which were all individual. Sessions were very behavioral in terms of understanding your rationale for applying for the job, how you deal with conflict, how you multitask and to communicate effectively.
Interview Questions: How do you build a community?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very fast interview about past experience, they ask what have you done in the past to get qualify for this position; what are some of your personal experiences and why are you applying for this particular position.
Interview Questions: They ask about your past IT experience and the interviewer is very nice and forgiven.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McMaster University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple and straightforward for an international student. All is really needed is a strong research statement.  Always be confident and sure about your objective in general for working in academia and in research and development. Hands on experience is an asset and helps you a lot. Computer skills and how to showcase them.
Interview Questions: you goals

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: They were looking to quickly fill a position, and they brought me in the day after I submitted my resume. They were very kind, and looked for skills such as my project management and communication.
Interview Questions: What are you biggest strengths?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
1. Interview with the Principal Investigator (PI). If PI approves, he/she introduces you to the lab.
2. Given a lab tour followed by interview with senior lab members
3. If senior lab members approve, PI extends a job offer
Interview Questions: Do you have lab experience? What kind of lab experience?

title: Service Centre Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was directly contacted by the person who would become my supervisor in the workplace. When I arrived, we sat in their office and had a brief conversation about my qualifications, the details regarding the expectations and the role I would be fulfilling, as well as when I would hear back. The next week or so, I got offered the position and started working there a couple of days following that.
Interview Questions: What experiences do you think make you qualified for this role?

title: Community Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Mar 2016

Interview Questions: Questions based on community building and student crisis response

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: good attentive interview process- HR works to make you feel comfortable. The job posting helps alot to help you prepare for the interview, re read that to ensure you know about the position.
Interview Questions: regular questions such as what are you strengths, weakness, advise on a struggle you overcame etc.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at McMaster University
Interview Descriptions: It was simple, emailed, follow up email, skype interview. They contacted me and we spent some time discussing pay, how much time I had to offer. We discussed duties, jobs, expectations.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? What type of research do you do?

title: Bistro and Restaurant Waiter Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Talked to the manager and handed in my resume. Did the interview the next day. The interview was about 10 to 15 minutes. Very general questions at the beginning and questions that you would expect to show up in a typical interview. I wasn't required to dress up and we did the interview in the restaurant.
Interview Questions:
What are your experiences?
What do you think that you are suitable for this job?
What are some of your strengths and how can they help you at the job?
How to handle a situation when there is an irritated customer or a quarrel among your coworkers?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Talk to a supervisor with a grant. He or she will let you know if there is a position available. They have a lot of work as McMaster is has been good at developing funding opportunities in the past.
Interview Questions: Can you do the work required?

title: Post Doctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: At first, My interview  was phone Interview  and  then In Person Interview with departmental Chair,Physics and Astronomy Department, at Mcmaster University, Hamilton.  After then I got offer from the university to work as a  post Doctoral researcher position. Finally, I have started to work at McMaster university. Mc Maste University is  a very good university and I am very happy to start work  at this re known university. Even though  this interview was very tough for me when they asked me  about my theoretical  question about physics.
Interview Questions: Tell us about youreself

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at McMaster University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Normally assigned a job if enough positions are available but can ask to be a TA for a specific course/professor (may not always get requested course though). Can take on extra TA hours with the authorization of your supervisor and based on availability.
Interview Questions: Preferred task (lab, tutorial, marking only, etc.)?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was basically the discussion of the job ad, posted online. I received a lot of clarification in person and even got insights of what past interns have done to succeed in the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Technical Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I had a referral from someone internal, so I bypassed the HR screening interview and went straight to an interview with the hiring department. It seems to be a necessity to know someone at McMaster in order to get your resume seen. 

Took about 4 weeks to arrange the interview. Interview itself went well, managers asked relevant job specific questions and situation specific questions. They didn't ask any of the typical annoying interview questions like "what is your greatest weakness" or "where do you see yourself 5 years from now."

Although it took four weeks to arrange the interview, I was offered the job one week exactly after the interview.
Interview Questions: Aside from what you've answered in previous questions, what else can you tell us about how your experience and viewpoints would benefit the work?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: interviewed with one person, pretty relaxed and friendly. made me feel comfortable. Very fair process, takes time but it was an insightful experience nonetheless. Very friendly interviewers. Had to be ready to explain why Marsh was my favorite option to apply for. Extremely satisfied with the outcome.
Interview Questions: tell me about your previous experiences

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at McMaster University
Interview Descriptions: hiring and interview process went smoothly. I applied online and got interview in four weeks. your cover letter got to include at least 50% of job qualifications. behavioral interviews are piece of cake.
Interview Questions: it was a case scenario, and you got to come up with a final solution. however not to intricate.

title: NSERC Research Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: Why do you want to conduct this research ?

Interview Questions: How would resolve conflict with a team?

title: Intern Interview

Interview Descriptions: contact through email, then telephone and set up an interview in person. Interview questions were fair and the interview was very professional. Overall, the interview was very professional and on the university campus.

Interview Questions: "Why do you want this job?"

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: Fairly routine interview process. And it didn't take too long.

title: Accounts Payable Clerk Interview

Interview Questions: What is the largest account you were responsible for?

title: Research Assistant Interview

Also asked about types of statistical software I had experience working with.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience working with statistics.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview

Why you want to be a TA?
Any previous experience before?

title: Web Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Apr 2013

Interview Questions: What is the difference between a static and dynamic method?

Interview Questions: What are you biggest strengths and weaknesses.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: every one who gets an offer for a graduate studies in mcmaster will automatically be consider for a TA position. To get admitted for a graduate program, you have to have at least a B+ average on your bachelor degree and if you are not from canada you have to have TOEFL exam. So there is no interview per sa.
Interview Questions: they may call and ask you some technical questions about your field

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Email the professors you want to work for. If you are lucky, one or more professors would like to hire you.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you can work for me since you do not have any specific expertise in my field?

title: Data Management Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
McMaster posts it's jobs online on the school website, but if you know someone that already works in one of the offices, you can also get a job through referrals. McMaster does that a lot, I find - asking people who are already staff if they know anyone that would fit a role. 

This is my third position at Mac, however (I love it so much I don't want to leave), and the first position I got was through the website and I had to go through an interview process. The interview was very straightforward and asked me the typical questions you would expect in an interview (strengths, weaknesses, biggest challenges faced in previous workplaces, etc.) I then recieved an e-mail about a week later with an offer for the position. 

My most recent position used an online HR software that required me to set up an account. It had my offer of employment, and several pertinent forms I had to fill out and bring with me on my first day on the job.
Interview Questions: The typical question they ask about what your personal weaknesses are...I always have trouble answering that one.

title: Department Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: A round table interview process with members of senior management and the staff of the dept. that the Dept. Manager would supervise.  The lead interviewer was the Senior Director of the area.  The round table went from person to person, asking around 10 questions in a 2 hour process.
Interview Questions: Behavioural interview with questions about how you handled particular scenarios.  What were the things you would do differently, who do you believe were your greatest accomplishments.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Long and drawn out for every job I've applied for - internal especially. I've applied for multiple internal positions as a current employee and the length of hiring time varies. It's usually at least a month, although I've received an interview request a full two months after a posting closed. I've never had to go in for more than one interview for an internal position.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions, I always get a lot of questions about computer skills (word, excel, database, accounting software, etc.) which I find interesting since so many co-worker have little to no computer skills (like can't use Excel for the most basic functionality).

title: Instructional Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by e-mail thanking me for my interest in the position and inviting me for an interview seven days from the date of the e-mail. I was to design an activity or assignment based on a presentation attached to the e-mail. The day of the interview I was greeted by the Department's secretary who showed me the original job posting . In the interview room were two professors, the instructional assistant manager, and the Department Chair as well as the secretary. They each took turns at interviewing me. Some of the questions asked were:
-what is your 5 year plan
-why this job
-I had to explain the rationale behind the assignment I designed
-situational questions
Interview Questions: In the assignment I had designed there was an alternative answer I had not considered. I took me by surprise.

title: Floor Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Email submission
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

in the second meeting, it was more about some of his ideas and facilities and my opinions about them and finally some questions about salary and benefits.
Interview Questions: Why you are coming for Postdoc? Go get a job!

The group interview portion is made up of a lot of different stations that mimmic what it is like to be "on the job".  I think it is done so that they see what your baseline behaviour is, before any specific training.
Interview Questions: Role playing with a depressed student!

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy interview for the position of a teaching assistant for a first year programming course. I knew the interviewer(course coordinator) from my first year. I applied after I got a mail from university asking undergraduate students to apply for the position. After the interview, they contacted me in 20 days to ask for my schedule so it matched the lab schedule for the course.
Interview Questions: What did you learn from this course?

title: IT Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Easy interview, just wanted to know a bit about my experience.
Good culture!
Helpful managers.
Lots of support
Interview Questions: What kind of work have you done in IT?

title: Student Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McMaster University (Hamilton, ON) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions:
The process was fairly straight forward. The first stage includes a preliminary filtering process through resumes. You then take a technical test/exam to test your knowledge with technoloy, customer service, and general computer terms. Your score on that then filters you through to the interview stage where you're they book an interview time and you show up to be interviewed by a panel of 2-3 existing staff. The staff included the supervisor and some senior consultants already been through the job. The interview took 15 minutes.

Questions included many experiential situations such as telling them a situation where you dealt with a problem and how you handled it. Required drawing on personal experience.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you dealt with a customer complaint and how you dealt with it
